title: Lesson 77
paragraph: This lesson focuses on wealth and materialism, including opulent, affluent, and extravagant lifestyles.

words.example: They lived in an opulent mansion.

words.meaning: having a great deal of money; wealthy
words.example: The affluent neighborhood had large houses.

words.meaning: exceeding what is reasonable or necessary

words.example: The wedding was a lavish affair.

words.meaning: designed to impress or attract notice
words.japaneseMeaning: 見せびらかしの、派手な
words.example: His ostentatious display of wealth annoyed many.

words.meaning: successful in material terms; flourishing financially
words.example: The region became prosperous after industrialization.

words.meaning: having or indicating a tendency to be overly generous
words.example: The indulgent host provided endless food and wine.

words.meaning: attempting to impress by affecting greater importance

words.japaneseMeaning: 物質主義の、金銭中心の
words.example: She is very materialistic, always chasing the latest gadgets.
